transcript.text: hi and welcome you listening to the x 22

there will be no report on thursday but

a great holiday season everyone is

most of these are headed in all

not believe the government that this

risen by two point eight five percent
they have been falling all of this time
and now they started to pop up a little

we've had layoffs hundreds of thousands

nobody is claiming unemployment

which doesn't fit the model of the

we're at five percent that everyone
would say okay everything is fine i'm

what we see is in october personal
spending really didn't go anywhere most
of the people are hoarding their money
they're nervous they're afraid because
all these people that have got laid off
they realize there's no jobs out there
and those people that have gotten work
it's not the high-paying jobs they once
had most people are getting part-time
jobs and a lot of these people are
putting their money and keeping it in

because this is all they have left but
what's very scary about this is that we
know the government is planning for a

understand once this happens there will
be balanced and a lot of these people
are going to have their money stuck in

scares me the most so right now you as
consumers they are unwilling to spend
their money out in the stores and this
is how we can tell already at the retail
sales for this holiday season is going
to be a complete disaster now since the
people aren't spending their money we
see durable good orders they are showing
right now a seven month in a row lows
they're continually declining and they
fall in year-over-year and this is your
washer your dryers
all these type of equipment people are
not going out and purchasing these type
of goods in the real estate market we
see mortgage applications they have
fallen again by three-point-two percent
ending the week of November 20th and new
home sales completely missed
expectations so right now new home sales
in which we find that in October a total
of about four hundred ninety-five
thousand new homes were sold of which
just a hundred and forty-six thousand
were completed the lowest in the past
year a hundred and seventy two thousand
under construction and a whopping a
hundred and seventy-seventh an house
177,000 houses sold which have never
been started this was the highest print
since 2007 still the headline numbers
while rising for the last month our
downward revised to 447,000 missed
expectations of 500,000 and we're seeing
that median home prices yeah they're
falling from 307,000 in September to now

we're seeing a lot of these houses that
were sold their never started ones that
are under construction are just not
finished and the whole housing market is

what we're seeing right now is that this

right now manufacturing is down to two

now we have unemployment at five percent
almost in full recovery so we should see

should be absolutely incredible I'm not

this is what they're telling us we
